description: Genetic engineering and protein engineering are powerful approaches to solve many of the problems that the humanity is facing. What are the problems that can be addressed by these approaches? What are the tools available for us to use? What are the issues and controversies? What should the public know? What kinds of public policies are needed to administer and regulate the relevant research and commercialization?
preclusion:
Students who have read a Freshman Seminar before will be precluded from reading a second Freshman Seminar.

Students staying in Residential Colleges in UTown who will be reading or have read the Junior Seminars will be precluded from reading Freshman Seminar in the Faculty.
title: From Genetic Engineering to Protein Engineering
